main event: Multiple UFO sightings were reported in New Orleans, Louisiana in 1955, including observations of round, silver objects hovering at high altitudes and exhibiting unusual maneuvering capabilities.
interesting points: A highly trained aircraft observer reported sighting an unidentified flying object in the vicinity of New Orleans, describing it as round in shape, silver in color, and approximately 20-25 feet in diameter.

A witness traveling on a highway in New Orleans observed a circular object about 40 feet in diameter emitting a steady white light, which hovered motionless before accelerating at a tremendous rate of speed.

Another observer, identified as a private citizen, reported sighting a round, bright object emitting a brilliant light and traveling at a high rate of speed, making a sharp 90-degree turn before disappearing from view.
One report described a sighting of a silver, delta-winged object over New Orleans, initially observed as an aircraft before being concluded to probably be a balloon by an investigative flight.
Several reports indicate the presence of highly reliable and trained observers, including military personnel and pilots, with clear weather conditions at the time of the sightings.
sighted object: round, silver objects exhibiting unusual maneuvering capabilities
witnesses: highly trained aircraft observer, a reliable witness in good visibility conditions, and pilots
